Thanks, Ron.=C2=A0=C2=A0 I did get 2 responses to this list and nothing fro=
m attempts to post on Chris' list,=C2=A0=C2=A0 Do you have any other sugges=
tions for selling this piece? =C2=A0 I hate to just post the photos on ebay=
 as the piece will be lost in the junk replicas there.=C2=A0 


Dennis

This site and also Chris =
Bowen's group does not 
allow photos. But, you can post them someplace like=
 Photobucket and then attach 
a link to your folder here. I haven't done th=
at myself for almost a year, so 
you'll have to brush up on posting photos =
on Photobucket; its free and easy to 
do. 
=C2=A0
Ron STL

=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 
  I am re-shuffling my stuff and came up with an old ts=
uba that I think is early 
  Aizu Ju Shoami.=C2=A0=C2=A0 It us signed, roun=
d, iron, and has gold inlayed 
  lines.=C2=A0=C2=A0 I can post photos or co=
ntact directly.=C2=A0=C2=A0 I will 
  probably sell this piece as it at 3 1=
/8 inch diameter is a bit small for the 
  1860s sword I had intended it fo=
r.=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 
  Dennis
